description.narrative: Programm ej inkomme; men lär omfatta: core funding, parliamentary support to MDGs incl.some support to aid effectiveness. Core funding-delen ska bidra till förbättring av AWEPAs kommunikationer och effektivitet. JN 2010-11-12.

description.narrative:
General question: Results related to the intended outcome 2015Question: Summarise results related to the intended outcome (this information will be sent to Open Aid)Answer: A particularly remarkable development in 2014 was the granting by Heads of State and Governments of enhanced powers to the Pan African Parliament and to the ECOWAS-Parliament. Both are now set to become legislative organs of the AU and ECOWAS respectively. While this is still subject to signature and ratification processes and will still take some time to materialise, this achievement is, like for EALA, testimony of the steady progress made by these institutions and their gradual consolidation as credible and democratic players on the African continent, and AWEPA has been part and parcel of their development and achievements.
In the MDGs programme inputs were geared towards poverty reduction and food security (MDG 1) and sustainability (MDG 7). Activities with PAP, SADC-PF, and CEMAC-P aimed at strengthening parliamentary capacity to tackle issues such as agricultural investment, large-scale land investment and water resource management. Some interventions focused on women’s empowerment and maternal health (MDG 3 and 5). Other interventions focused on broader matters, affecting the whole MDG agenda, such as Peace, Security & Development and Migration & Development.
In the EALA programme, AWEPA facilitated the drafting of 3 Private Member Bills and supported the consultative processes for the EAC Integration (Education) Bill and for various Bills related to the Customs Union and the Monetary Union. Likewise, EALA increased its visibility among stakeholders through sustained public outreach and a communications and marketing policy, supported by AWEPA. In addition, engagement with civil society has been taken a notch higher , with clear initiatives to include citizens’ voices in relevant processes within the regional parliament. EALA has also made significant progress on its mandate regarding elections regulations and monitoring. The Bills and outreaches go a long way in contributing to the achievement of further unifying the EAC.
In 2014 AWEPA worked through it's structures namely the Eminent Advisory Board, the Partnership Council, the Governing Council, the Executive Committee, Political Coordinators and the Senior Parliamentary Bodies in order to provide political guidance for countries, regions and programmes in Africa and Europe. Several activities focused on the capacity strengthening of parliaments in the transition towards the post-2015 development agenda (MDG 8). These focus areas are critical to the implementation of the post-2015 Sustainable Development Goals. These activities contributed in strengthening both the governance structures and the Secretariat for smooth running of the organisation.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
